data.title: Once, I created an illustration for Carp magazine about Ruud Lubbers, the then Prime Minister. I went wild with a collage (and my vintage...
data.meta_description:
59 likes, 4 comments - marenthe on May 13, 2024: "Once, I created an illustration for Carp magazine about Ruud Lubbers, the then Prime Minister. 

I went wild with a collage (and my vintage type-writer).

Ruud was a notable figure. 

- He had a gap between his front teeth, which he corrected; yet, nobody noticed until the Volkskrant (a Dutch newspaper) broke the story 1.5 years later.

- He had some great hobbies, like writing poetry and visiting cemeteries.

- He had to shave several times a day because his beard grew like crazy.

There‚Äôs also a quirky anecdote about Ruud at a conference with 340 attendees. Cas Spijkers, a renowned chef, prepared the lunch, but Ruud sent it back, requesting ‚Äújust a sandwich‚Äù. 

Cas was not amused.

Once, Ruud unexpectedly showed up at my door. He was older then and visiting a politician who lived below me. Confused, Ruud asked for help with the parking meter. I assisted him‚Äîa charming encounter, though I regret not inviting him in for coffee.

What a flood of memories an old illustration can bring back.

üî•üî•üî•

And speaking of creativity, I‚Äôm hosting a masterclass on collage-making on June 2nd!
It‚Äôs a day to honor the art of collage. It may seem simple, but it demands a fresh perspective. Join me for what‚Äôs sure to be a super fun and creative day. Find the details in my bio.

M‚ù§Ô∏è

#carp #editorial #editorialillustration #collage #collageart #ruudlubbers #primeminister #magazine #lillarogers #marenthe #theartbeatclub".
